Subjective: Left ear pain and fullness; feels like water inside. Onset 2-3 days ago, gradually worsening. Associated decreased hearing in left ear. Pain is 3-4/10, increases to 6-7/10 after showering. Pain is manageable. Unable to swim due to pain. No fever, feels generally well. No painkillers taken. Social: New swimmer (few weeks). Cleans ears with cotton buds 3x/week. Request: Wants ear examined for cause and pain relief; concerned about hearing.
Objective: Vitals: Temp 36.2 C. Right Ear: Canal clear, tympanic membrane normal. Left Ear: Pain on pinna pull. External auditory canal is red, swollen, and inflamed. Tympanic membrane poorly visualized due to swelling.
Assessment: Otitis Externa, left ear. Suspected secondary to frequent water exposure and cotton bud use.
Plan: Paracetamol up to 4000mg daily as needed for pain.
Prescribed acidic, anti-inflammatory ear drops, three times a day for one week.
Advice: Keep left ear dry for one week.
Advice: Stop cleaning ears with cotton buds.
Follow-up: Return for consultation in one week.
